newsitem.title: USA: CBOT July soymeal ends limit down, Brazil imports.
newsitem.headline: CBOT July soymeal ends limit down, Brazil imports.

text.p: CBOT July soymeal futures ended limit down on Wednesday, pressured by confirmation that a U.S. firm is importing soybeans from Brazil, floor traders said.

"Cargill has contracted to import soybeans from Brazil for use in our processing plants in the southeastern United States, where the (soybean) shortage is particularly acute," the company said in a statement.
The import news also caused limit-down losses in July soybeans and knocked soyoil futures to sharply lower closes, traders said.
The Brazilian processor Ceval Ailmentos also confirmed on Wednesday that it was in talks to sell 40,000 tonnes of soymeal to an unnamed buyer in the U.S.
Market sources said that the Brazilian meal was purchased by an East Coast hog producer.
The pool of unfilled sell orders in July soymeal was estimated at 150 to 300 lots, pit traders said.
CBOT soymeal futures ended $0.20 to $10.00 per ton lower, with July down $10.00 at $273.10 a ton. Soyoil settled 0.55 to 0.30 cent per lb lower, with July down 0.51 at 23.34 cents.
